page.title: 16COGRA MOSS, LAMPLUGH.
page.content: The Cockermouth Anglers have the sporting rights on Cogra Moss. The lake belongs to the North West Water Authority. Fishing is closed from the 30th Sept. to 1st April. The Association has 75 members, there is no age limit. To join you apply to the secretary to go onto a waiting list. To fish you need a rod, fly line, nylon for the cast, landing net, priest and flies. Rainbow Trout don't live in the lake naturally but some Brown Trout and Perch do. The club puts about 300 fish in the lake every 2 weeks which they buy from Gilcrux Lake District Trout Farm and Marron Fish Farm at Braithwaite. The fish weigh about 1 pound and when they are caught they are still about the same weight. Some of the birds at Cogra Moss are, Common Sand Piper, Mallard, Coot and a pair of Crested Grebes.
